Text.Page:
It's been 500 days since I met Elleon.
They say that Elleon refused to be the head of his family, but I know that's not the truth.
Elleon doesn't know his numbers so he couldn't even if he wanted to. All he knows about is battle and swords.

I guess they don't teach math at the Mysterium.

Once, he came back with a dirty sword.
He said that the owner sold it in a hurry and it's almost impossible to get a quality sword at that price.

Rubbish. I'm sure that someday he'll end up dying on a battlefield.

The man that sold the sword must have no conscience whatsoever.Next page.

I felt pity for Elleon, so I told him that I'll sharpen the sword for him. He said that he would hunt some monsters first.

With that pathetic sword, he still slaughtered those monsters.

Slaughtered them good.

He might not know numbers, but he's one amazing swordsman. I hope he never finds out I wrote this.

(The next page is torn off.)Stop reading.
